<P ID=PARA4037 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4049 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Revolving Credit Facility
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4050 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4051 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On October&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015, all outstanding principal and interest obligations outstanding under the Company&#8217;s Revolving Credit and Security Agreement, dated May 12, 2011 with PNC (the "Loan Agreement" or the &#8220;Credit Facility&#8221;) were repaid in full in conjunction with the Company&#8217;s new financing agreements. The Credit Facility was replaced by the new financing agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4052 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4053 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Note Payable &#8211;
</I>
<I>
	Related Party
</I>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4054 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4055 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During 2015, the Company has received the proceeds of subordinated indebtedness from GFCM in an amount of $5,500,000. GFCM is an entity controlled by our president and chief executive officer, Jeffrey T. Gill and one of our directors, R. Scott Gill. GFCM, Jeffrey T. Gill and R. Scott Gill are significant beneficial stockholders of the Company. The promissory note bears interest at a rate of 8.00% per year. All principal and interest on the promissory note, as amended, will be due and payable on January&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2019.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4056 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4057 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On February 26, 2016, the Company further amended the GFCM note to increase the amount by $1,000,000 to $6,500,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4058 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4059 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Note Payable &#8211; Meritor
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4060 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4061 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On July 2, 2015, the Company entered into a secured promissory note (the &#8220;Meritor Note&#8221;) in the principal amount of $3,047,000, with Meritor, in exchange for the release of certain outstanding net trade payables owed to Meritor for ongoing purchases of raw materials and the guarantee of certain inventory values related to Meritor&#8217;s business as collateral under the Credit Facility. The Meritor Note was secured by substantially all of the collateral for the Credit Facility, was senior to the promissory note previously issued to GFCM and was subordinate to the rights under the Credit Facility. The Meritor Note bore interest at a rate of 10.0% per year and all principal and interest on the Meritor Note was due and payable on the maturity date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4062 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4063 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On July 9, 2015, the Company entered an asset purchase agreement to sell certain assets and related liabilities used in the Company&#8217;s manufacturing facility in Morganton, North Carolina, to Meritor for $12,500,000. Meritor also agreed to purchase the Morganton plan facility and real estate for $3,200,000. At closing, the parties also entered into a Meritor Note Amendment, whereby the Company issued an additional secured obligation to Meritor of $412,000 on July&nbsp;9,&nbsp;2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	for the release of certain outstanding net trade payables and other accrued liabilities and further agreed to increase the Meritor Note by an additional $321,000 in September to reflect certain potential roof repairs required at the Morganton facility.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4064 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4065 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On October&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015, the Meritor Note and interest were repaid in full in conjunction with the Company&#8217;s new financing agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4066 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4067 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	New Credit Facility and Term Loan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4068 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4069 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On October&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015, the Company secured debt financing consisting of a $12,000,000 term loan (&#8220;Term Loan&#8221;) and a $15,000,000 revolving credit facility (&#8220;New Credit Facility&#8221;). Proceeds from the two new financing arrangements (collectively the &#8220;New Loan Agreements&#8221;) were used in part to repay the Credit Facility and the Meritor Note. Borrowing availability under the New Credit Facility is determined by a weekly borrowing base collateral calculation that includes specified percentages of the value of eligible accounts receivable and inventory, less certain reserves and subject to certain other adjustments. Borrowing availability under the Term Loan is also evaluated using a separate borrowing base collateral calculation that includes designated percentages of real estate, machinery and equipment appraisals, in each case less certain reserves and subject to certain other adjustments. If the appraised values of such collateral causes the Term Loan borrowing base to fall below the then current Term Loan balance, the Company is required to make a partial prepayment of such difference and related fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4070 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK2903 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR2903 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM2903 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	52
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR2903 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA2903.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3602 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3603 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3604 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4071 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Based on the above mentioned calculation, at December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2015, the Company had actual total borrowing base availability under the New Credit Facility of $8,369,000 of which it had drawn $2,132,000, leaving $6,237,000 still available for borrowing, $4,000,000 of which was reserved for compliance with the minimum excess availability provisions of the New Credit Facility. Along with an unrestricted cash balance of $1,349,000, the Company had total cash and available borrowing capacity of $3,586,000 as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. Approximately $1,183,000 of this unrestricted cash balance related to the Company&#8217;s Mexican subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4072 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4073 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Obligations under the New Loan Agreements are guaranteed by all of our U.S. subsidiaries and are secured by a first priority lien on substantially all assets of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4074 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4075 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On February 25, 2016, the Company entered into an amendment (the &#8220;Term Loan Amendment&#8221;) to the Term Loan and an amendment (the &#8220;New Credit Amendment&#8221;) to the New Credit Facility (together, the &#8220;Amendments&#8221;). The Amendments will have the effect, among other things, of increasing the Company&#8217;s borrowing capability under its New Credit Facility and providing for an agreement on use of proceeds from the sale of its Toluca, Mexico property and buildings, as described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4076 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4077 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As a result of the Term Loan Amendment, the Company deposited $6,000,000 of the proceeds of the sale-leaseback of its Toluca, Mexico property and buildings (the &#8220;Toluca Sale-Leaseback&#8221;) into a Cash Collateral Account, to be held for up to one year as additional collateral for the Term Loan. Amounts deposited in the Cash Collateral Account that are used to prepay the principal of the Term Loan must be accompanied by the payment of a make-whole amount by the Company equal to the present value of any unpaid interest that would have been paid on the prepaid portion of the Term Loan through the one year anniversary of the Term Loan Amendment. The Term Loan Amendment further provides that the Company will be permitted to retain the remaining balance of the proceeds from Toluca Sale-Leaseback, and increases the interest rate of the Term Loan by 1.0%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4078 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4079 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In addition, under the Term Loan Amendment and New Credit Facility Amendment, the Company&#8217;s minimum excess availability provision was reduced from $4,000,000 to $3,000,000. The lender further agreed to remove certain reserves which had been established against the Company&#8217;s &#8220;borrowing base.&#8221; These changes are estimated to provide the Company with $1,655,000 in additional borrowing capacity under the New Credit Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4080 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4081 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company&#8217;s obligations under each of the New Credit Facility and the Term Loan, as amended, continue to be guaranteed by the Company&#8217;s U.S. subsidiaries and are secured by a first priority lien on substantially all assets of the Company and the guarantors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4082 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4083 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The New Loan Agreements, as amended, contain a number of customary representations and warranties, affirmative, negative and financial maintenance covenants, events of default and remedies upon default, including acceleration and rights to foreclose on the collateral securing each lender. If the Company&#8217;s borrowing availability under the amended New Credit Facility falls below $3,000,000, the Company must maintain a fixed charge coverage ratio of at least 1 to 1, as measured on a trailing twelve months&#8217; basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4084 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4085 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Non-compliance with the Company&#8217;s debt covenants would provide the debt holders with certain contractual rights, including the right to demand immediate repayment of all outstanding borrowings.&nbsp; Since the loss of the Dana business (see Note 2 &#8220;Management&#8217;s Recovery Plans&#8221;), the Company has also experienced negative cash flows from consolidated operations which could hamper or materially increase the costs of the Company&#8217;s ability to comply with such covenants. &nbsp;The Company&#8217;s consolidated financial statements have been prepared assuming the ongoing realization of assets, satisfaction of liabilities and continuity of operations as a going concern in the ordinary course of business, but there can be no assurances that the Company&#8217;s current initiatives, forecasts and plans will ultimately succeed, which could materially and adversely impair the Company&#8217;s ability to operate, its cash flows, financial condition and ongoing results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4086 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4087 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The classification of debt as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 considers the debt refinanced on a long-term basis. However, the New Credit Facility allows the lender to establish certain reserves against the borrowing base which could, under certain circumstances, cause a potential event of default. Because such an event is not objectively measureable in advance and because the Company is required to maintain a lock-box arrangement, ASC 470-10-45 requires the otherwise long-term revolving advances to be classified as a current liability. As a result, all borrowings under the revolving advances have been classified in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as a current liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4088 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK2904 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR2904 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM2904 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	53
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR2904 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA2904.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3605 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3606 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3607 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4089 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The weighted average interest rate for outstanding borrowings at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 was 10.5%. The weighted average interest rates for borrowings during the years ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014 were 7.2% and 2.5%, respectively. The Company had no capitalized interest in 2015 or 2014. Interest paid during the years ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014 totaled approximately $1,436,000 and $397,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4090 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4091 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Based on the current forecast for 2016, the Company expects to be able to maintain the minimum required level of borrowing availability of its amended New Loan Agreements. Although the Company believes the assumptions underlying its current forecast are realistic, the Company has considered the possibility of even lower revenues and other risk factors such as its ability to onboard new business within Sypris Technologies, continued delays in program bookings within Sypris Electronics, or its ability to execute its current contingency plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4092 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4092 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>

<P ID=PARA4094 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4095 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued liabilities are reflected in the consolidated financial statements at their carrying amount which approximates fair value because of the short-term maturity of those instruments. The carrying amount of debt outstanding at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 under the New Credit Facility and Term Loan approximates fair value, and is based upon a market approach (Level 2).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4096 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">

<P ID=PARA2949>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Employee Benefit Plans
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4098 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4099 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Sypris Technologies sponsors noncontributory defined benefit pension plans (the &#8220;Pension Plans&#8221;) covering certain of its employees. The Pension Plans covering salaried and management employees provide pension benefits that are based on the employees&#8217; highest five-year average compensation within ten years before retirement. The Pension Plans covering hourly employees and union members generally provide benefits at stated amounts for each year of service. All of the Company&#8217;s pension plans are frozen to new participants and certain plans are frozen to additional benefit accruals. The Company&#8217;s funding policy is to make the minimum annual contributions required by the applicable regulations. The Pension Plans&#8217; assets are primarily invested in equity securities and fixed income securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4100 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

<P ID=PARA4187 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4207 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Investments in our defined benefit plans are stated at fair value. The following valuation methods were used to value our pension assets:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4208 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_24"></A>
<TABLE ID=TBL3164 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; PADDING-LEFT: 9PT">
<P ID=PARA3158 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Equity securities
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3159 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The fair value of equity securities is determined by either direct or indirect quoted market prices. When the value of assets held in separate accounts is not published, the value is based on the underlying holdings, which are primarily direct quoted market prices on regulated financial exchanges.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; PADDING-LEFT: 9PT">
<P ID=PARA3160 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Fixed income securities
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3161 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The fair value of fixed income securities is determined by either direct or indirect quoted market prices. When the value of assets held in separate accounts is not published, the value is based on the underlying holdings, which are primarily direct quoted market prices on regulated financial exchanges.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 40%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; PADDING-LEFT: 9PT">
<P ID=PARA3162 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 60%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3163 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The fair value of cash and cash equivalents is set equal to its cost.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4209 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 180PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -171PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4215 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The methods described above may produce a fair value calculation that may not be indicative of net realizable value or reflective of future fair values. Furthermore, while the Company believes the valuation methods are appropriate and consistent with other market participants, the use of different methodologies or assumptions to determine the fair value of certain financial instruments could result in a different fair value measurement at the reporting date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4216 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4217 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company uses December&nbsp;31 as the measurement date for the Pension Plans. There are no amounts expected to be paid to the plans during 2016 as designated under the minimum funding amounts required by federal law. The expected long-term rates of return on plan assets for determining net periodic pension cost for 2015 and 2014 were chosen by the Company from a best estimate range determined by applying anticipated long-term returns and long-term volatility for various assets categories to the target asset allocation of the plan. The target asset allocation of plan assets is equity securities ranging 0-55%, fixed income securities ranging 35-100% and non-traditional/other of 0-10% of total investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4218 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4219 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Accumulated other comprehensive loss at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 includes $16,206,000 of unrecognized actuarial losses that have not yet been recognized in net periodic pension cost. The actuarial loss included in accumulated other comprehensive loss and expected to be recognized in net periodic pension cost during the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 is $697,000. The actual loss reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive loss for 2015 and 2014 was $694,000 and $531,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4220 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4223 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 99PT 0PT 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4232 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company sponsors a defined contribution plan (the &#8220;Defined Contribution Plan&#8221;) for substantially all domestic employees of the Company. The Defined Contribution Plan is intended to meet the requirements of Section 401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Defined Contribution Plan allows the Company to match participant contributions up to 3% and provide discretionary contributions. Contributions to the Defined Contribution Plan by the Company in 2015 and 2014 totaled approximately $930,000 and $1,137,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4233 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4234 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company has self-insured medical plans (the &#8220;Medical Plans&#8221;) covering substantially all domestic employees. The number of employees participating in the Medical Plans was approximately 423 and 670 at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014, respectively. The Medical Plans limit the Company&#8217;s annual obligations to fund claims to specified amounts per participant. The Company is insured for amounts in excess of these limits. Employees are responsible for payment of a portion of the premiums. During 2015 and 2014, the Company charged approximately $4,058,000 and $4,967,000, respectively, to operations related to medical claims incurred and estimated, reinsurance premiums, and administrative costs for the Medical Plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4235 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4236 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In addition, certain of the Company&#8217;s non-U.S.&nbsp;employees are covered by various defined benefit and defined contribution plans. The Company&#8217;s expenses for these plans totaled approximately $30,000 and $26,000 in 2015 and 2014, respectively. The aggregate benefit plan assets and accumulated benefit obligation of these plans are not significant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4237 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</P>

	Rent expense for the years ended December

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2015 and 2014 totaled approximately $2,700,000 and $2,849,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4252 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4253 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As of December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2015, the Company had outstanding purchase commitments of approximately $6,168,000 primarily for the acquisition of inventory.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4254 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4255 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company bears insurance risk as a member of a group captive insurance entity for certain general liability, automobile and workers&#8217; compensation insurance programs, a self-insured worker&#8217;s compensation program and a self-insured employee health program. The Company records estimated liabilities for its insurance programs based on information provided by the third-party plan administrators, historical claims experience, expected costs of claims incurred but not paid, and expected costs to settle unpaid claims. The Company monitors its estimated insurance-related liabilities on a quarterly basis. As facts change, it may become necessary to make adjustments that could be material to the Company&#8217;s consolidated results of operations and financial condition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4256 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">

<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">

	&nbsp;

<P ID=PARA3194.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3617 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3618 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3619 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4257 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company is involved in certain litigation and contract issues arising in the normal course of business. While the outcome of these matters cannot, at this time, be predicted in light of the uncertainties inherent therein, management does not expect that these matters will have a material adverse effect on the consolidated financial position or results of operations of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4258 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4259 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company accounts for loss contingencies in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).&nbsp; Estimated loss contingencies are accrued only if the loss is probable and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated.&nbsp; With respect to a particular loss contingency, it may be probable that a loss has occurred but the estimate of the loss is within a wide range or undeterminable.&nbsp; If the Company deems an amount within the range to be a better estimate than any other amount within the range, that amount will be accrued.&nbsp; However, if no amount within the range is a better estimate than any other amount, the minimum amount of the range is accrued.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4260 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4261 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During the fourth quarter of 2015, the Company gave notification regarding its intention to not renew the lease for its Tampa, FL facility, which will expire on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2016. However, subsequent to year end, the Company entered into lease negotiations which would extend the current lease for a smaller portion of the facility on more favorable terms. However, there can be no assurance that an agreement will be reached. As such, it is reasonably possible that the Company may be required to make certain repairs to the facility upon exit, which may be significant. While the Company believes that a potential loss contingency may exist, it cannot currently estimate the amount of the contingency.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4262 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4263 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company has various current and previously-owned facilities subject to a variety of environmental regulations. The Company has received certain indemnifications from either companies previously owning these facilities or from purchasers of those facilities. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014, no amounts were accrued for any environmental matters. See &#8220;Legal Proceedings&#8221; in Part I, Item 3 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4264 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4265 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Subsequent to year end, the Company entered into a sale lease-back agreement with Promotora&nbsp;y&nbsp;Desarrolladora Pulso Inmobiliario, S.C.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	(&#8220;Pulso&#8221;) whereby it sold the entire facility and leased back the portion of the facility currently occupied by the Company in Toluca, Mexico, for our continued use as a manufacturing facility for ten years commencing upon the execution of the lease and terminating on March&nbsp;9,&nbsp;2026. The Company&#8217;s base rent, which is denominated in U.S. currency, is $936,000 annually, adjusted based on U.S. CPI with certain cap conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4266 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TR>

<P ID=PARA3238>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Stock Option and Purchase Plans
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4268 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4269 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company&#8217;s stock compensation program provides for the grant of restricted stock (including performance-based restricted stock), unrestricted stock, stock options and stock appreciation rights. A total of 3,655,088 shares of common stock were registered for issuance under the 2010 Omnibus Plan. On May 19, 2015, the 2010 Sypris Omnibus Plan was replaced with the 2015 Sypris Omnibus Plan. A total of 3,476,021 shares were registered for issuance under the 2015 Omnibus Plan. Additionally, awards under the 2010 Omnibus Plan that are cancelled without having been fully exercised or vested are available again for new awards under the 2015 Omnibus Plan. The aggregate number of shares available for future grant as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014 was 3,476,021 and 1,052,021, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4270 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4271 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The 2010 Omnibus Plan provides for restrictions which lapse after three years. During the restricted period, which is commensurate with each vesting period, the recipient has the right to receive dividends and voting rights for the shares. Generally, if a recipient leaves the Company before the end of the restricted period or if performance requirements, if any, are not met, the shares will be forfeited. During 2015, the Company modified the restriction on certain restricted stock grants to increase the restriction period by one year. The modification did not have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4272 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4273 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company has certain stock compensation plans under which options to purchase common stock may be granted to officers, key employees and non-employee directors. Options may be granted at not less than the market price on the date of grant. Stock option grants under the 2010 Omnibus Plan include a five year life along with vesting after three years of service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4274 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3195 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3195 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3195 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	58
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3195 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3195.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3620 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3621 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3622 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4275 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Compensation expense is measured based on the fair value at the date of grant and is recognized on a straight-line basis over the vesting period. Fair value for restricted shares is equal to the stock price on the date of grant, while the fair value of each stock option grant is estimated on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing method. The Company uses historical Company and industry data to estimate the expected price volatility, the expected option life, the expected forfeiture rate and the expected dividend yield. The risk-free rate is based on the U.S. Treasury yield curve in effect at the time of grant for the estimated life of the option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4276 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4277 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The following weighted average assumptions were used to estimate the fair value of options granted using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4278 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</B>
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL3211.FINROW.1.AMT.D3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1PX SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT" COLSPAN=6>

</TD>
<TD ID=TBL3211.FINROW.1.TRAIL.D3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX">

</B>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR ID=TBL3211.FINROW.2>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL3211.FINROW.2.LEAD.D2 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<B>
	&nbsp;

<P ID=PARA4288 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4299 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The total fair value of shares vested during 2015 and 2014 was $230,000 and $773,000, respectively. In conjunction with the vesting of restricted shares and payment of taxes thereon, the Company received into treasury 28,999 and 98,251 restricted shares, respectively, at an average price of $2.65 and $2.81 per share, respectively, the closing market price on the date the restricted stock vested. Such repurchased shares were immediately cancelled.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P ID=PARA4317 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The weighted average grant date fair value based on the Black-Scholes option pricing model for options granted in the years ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014 was $0.82 and $0.99 per share, respectively. There were no options exercised in 2015 and 201,589 options exercised in 2014. The total intrinsic value of options exercised was $417,000 during the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4318 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4319 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, there was $1,037,000 of total unrecognized compensation cost, after estimated forfeitures, related to unvested share-based compensation granted under the plans. That cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 0.9 years. The total fair value of option shares vested during the years ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014 was not material.
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA4322 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4323 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014, 24,850 shares of the Company&#8217;s preferred stock were designated as Series A Preferred Stock in accordance with the terms of our stockholder rights plan, which expired in October 2011. There are no shares of Series A Preferred Stock currently outstanding, and there are no current plans to issue any such shares. Any future holders of Series A Preferred Stock, as currently designated, would have voting rights, be entitled to receive dividends based on a defined formula and have certain rights in the event of the Company&#8217;s dissolution. Any such shares of Series A Preferred Stock would not be redeemable. However, the Company would be entitled to purchase shares of Series A Preferred Stock in the open market or pursuant to an offer to a holder or holders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4324 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The holders of our common stock were not entitled to any payment as a result of the expiration of the rights plan and the rights issued thereunder.
</FONT>
</P>

	Income Taxes

<P ID=PARA4341 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4342 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company accounts for income taxes under the liability method. Accordingly, deferred income taxes have been provided for temporary differences between the recognition of revenue and expenses for financial and income tax reporting purposes and between the tax basis of assets and liabilities and their reported amounts in the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4343 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">

<P ID=PARA4358 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4376 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company files a consolidated federal income tax return which includes all domestic subsidiaries. State income taxes paid in the U.S. during 2015 and 2014 totaled $120,000 and $33,000, respectively. State income tax refunds received in the U.S. during 2015 totaled $30,000. Foreign income taxes paid during 2015 and 2014 totaled $2,195,000 and $1,063,000, respectively. There were no foreign refunds received in 2015 and 2014. There were no federal taxes paid in 2015 and 2014, and there were no federal refunds received in 2015 and 2014. At December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, the Company had $132,040,000 of federal net operating loss carryforwards available to offset future federal taxable income, which will expire in various amounts from 2024 to 2035.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4377 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4378 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had $137,645,000 of state net operating loss carryforwards available to offset future state taxable income, the majority of which relates to Florida and Kentucky. These carryforwards expire in various amounts from 2018 to 2035.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4379 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4382 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4397 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	ASC 740,
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
<I>
	,
</I>
	requires that a valuation allowance be established when it is more likely than not that all or a portion of a deferred tax asset will not be realized. The net cumulative domestic loss for the current and prior two years represents negative evidence under the provisions of ASC 740 requiring the Company to establish a valuation allowance against domestic deferred tax assets. Until an appropriate level and characterization of profitability is attained, the Company expects to continue to maintain a valuation allowance on its net deferred tax assets related to future U.S. and certain non-U.S. tax benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4398 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4399 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The gross deferred tax asset for the Company&#8217;s Mexican subsidiaries was $4,033,000 and $2,556,000 as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The net deferred tax asset balance of $2,556,000 at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014 is attributable to the Mexican subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4400 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3374 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3374 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3374 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	61
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3374 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3374.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3629 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3630 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3631 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4401 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As a result of the increased uncertainty surrounding the Company&#8217;s forecast of taxable income in Mexico, it was determined that the Company no longer met the &#8220;more likely than not&#8221; threshold required under ASC 740-10 in order to maintain the Mexico deferred tax asset. Accordingly, the Company recorded a valuation allowance on its net deferred tax asset related to certain non-U.S. tax benefits, resulting in deferred tax expense of $2,230,000 during year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015. Until an appropriate level and characterization of profitability is attained, the Company expects to continue to maintain a valuation allowance on its net deferred tax assets related to future U.S. and non-U.S. tax benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4402 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4405 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA4432 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The ASC Income Tax topic includes guidance for the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#8217;s financials. Specifically, the guidance prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return and also provides guidance on derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure, and transition. The total amount of gross unrecognized tax benefits as of December 31, 2015 and 2014 was $200,000. There were no changes to the unrecognized tax benefit balance during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4433 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4434 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	If the Company&#8217;s positions are sustained by the taxing authority in favor of the Company, the entire balance at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 would reduce the Company&#8217;s effective tax rate. The Company does not expect its unrecognized tax benefits to change significantly over the next 12&nbsp;months. The Company recognizes accrued interest and penalties related to uncertain tax positions in income tax expense. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014, the Company does not have an accrual for the payment of tax-related interest and penalties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4435 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4436 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company files income tax returns in the U.S. federal jurisdiction, and various state and foreign jurisdictions. The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is not currently examining the Company&#8217;s U.S. income tax returns for 2011 through 2014, for which the statute has yet to expire. In addition, open tax years related to state and foreign jurisdictions remain subject to examination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4437 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4438 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015, the Company has no undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries that are classified as permanently reinvested. The Company did not repatriate any funds to the U.S during 2015 and expects the repatriation of any available non-U.S. cash holdings during 2016 will be limited to the amount of undistributed earnings as of December 31, 2015.&nbsp; The loss recognized by the Company&#8217;s Mexican operations during 2015 reduced the undistributed earnings of that entity and the Company has therefore recognized a deferred income tax benefit equal to the reduction in the U.S deferred tax liability and a corresponding increase in the deferred tax asset valuation allowance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4439 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3431 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3431 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGBK3431 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3431 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3431 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	62
</DIV>

</P>
<P ID=PARA3632 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3633 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED

</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3634 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<TABLE ID=TBL4440 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3434>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE ID=TBL4440 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3434>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	(
</B>
<B>
	21
</B>
<B>
	)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3435>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Loss
</B>
<B>
	Per Common Share
</B>
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4441 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4442 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company computes earnings per share using the two-class method, which is an earnings allocation formula that determines earnings per share for common stock and participating securities. Restricted stock granted by the Company is considered a participating security since it contains a non-forfeitable right to dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4443 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4444 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our potentially dilutive securities include potential common shares related to our stock options and restricted stock. Diluted earnings per share considers the impact of potentially dilutive securities except in periods in which there is a loss because the inclusion of the potential common shares would have an anti-dilutive effect. Diluted earnings per share excludes the impact of common shares related to our stock options in periods in which the option exercise price is greater than the average market price of our common stock for the period. All potential common shares were excluded from diluted earnings per share for the year ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2015 and 2014 because the effect of inclusion would be anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4445 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4446 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">

</FONT>
</P>

<TD ID=TBL3466.FINROW.12.AMT.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 14%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 3PX DOUBLE; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF">
	19,586
</TD>
<TD ID=TBL3466.FINROW.12.TRAIL.3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 3PX; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" NOWRAP>
	&nbsp;

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4448 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4448 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE ID=TBL4466 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3467>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	(
</B>
<B>
	22
</B>
<B>
	)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3468>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Segment Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4467 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4468 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company is organized into two business segments, Sypris Technologies and Sypris Electronics. The segments are each managed separately because of the distinctions between the products, services, markets, customers, technologies, and workforce skills of the segments. Sypris Technologies provides manufacturing services for a variety of customers that outsource forged and finished steel components and subassemblies. Sypris Technologies also manufactures high-pressure closures and other fabricated products. Sypris Electronics provides manufacturing and technical services as an outsourced service provider and manufactures complex data storage systems. Revenue derived from outsourced services for Sypris Technologies accounted for 61% and 85% of total net revenue in 2015 and 2014, respectively. Revenue derived from outsourced services for Sypris Electronics accounted for 17% and 6% of total net revenue in 2015 and 2014, respectively. There was no intersegment net revenue recognized for any year presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4469 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV ID=PGFTR3469 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3469 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	63

	The Company&#8217;s export sales from the U.S. totaled $34,830,000 and $58,498,000 in 2015 and 2014, respectively. Approximately $8,889,000 and $111,177,000 of net revenue in 2015 and 2014, respectively, and $5,807,000 and $13,033,000 of long lived assets at December

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2015 and 2014, respectively, and net assets of $9,696,000 and $20,388,000 at December
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2015 and 2014 relate to the Company&#8217;s international operations.

<P ID=PARA3569.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3638 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SYPRIS SOLUTIONS, INC.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3639 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS &#8211; CONTINUED
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3640 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE ID=TBL4537 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3570>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE ID=TBL4537 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3570>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	(2
</B>
<B>
	3
</B>
<B>
	)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA3571>
<B>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Subsequent Events
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA4538 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4539 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On February 25, 2016, the Company entered into an amendment to the Term Loan and an amendment to the New Credit Facility. The Amendments will have the effect, among other things, of increasing the Company&#8217;s borrowing capability under its New Credit Facility and providing for an agreement on use of proceeds from the sale of its Toluca, Mexico property and buildings, as described below. As part of the Amendments, the Company also received an additional $1,000,000 subordinated loan from GFCM, as described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4540 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4541 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As a result of the Term Loan Amendment, the Company deposited $6,000,000 of the proceeds of the Toluca Sale-Leaseback into a Cash Collateral Account, to be held for up to one year as additional collateral for the Term Loan. The Term Loan Amendment further provides that the Company will be permitted to retain the remaining balance of the proceeds from Toluca Sale-Leaseback, and increases the interest rate of the Term Loan by 1.0%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4542 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4543 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In addition, under the Amendments, the lenders agreed to reduce the Company&#8217;s minimum excess availability provision from $4,000,000 to $3,000,000 to remove certain reserves which had been established against the Company&#8217;s &#8220;borrowing base.&#8221; These changes are estimated to provide the Company with $1,655,000 in additional borrowing capacity under the amended New Credit Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4544 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4545 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In connection with the Amendments, the Company has retained a financial advisor to review the Company&#8217;s existing business plan and make recommendations in the form of a revised business plan. If the Company meets certain milestones as determined by the Term Loan lender after its review of such plan, up to $1,000,000 may be released from the Cash Collateral Account to the Company. The Company&#8217;s obligations under each of the New Credit Facility and the Term Loan, as amended, continue to be guaranteed by the Company&#8217;s U.S. subsidiaries and are secured by a first priority lien on substantially all assets of the Company and the guarantors. Each of the Amendments contains certain customary representations, warranties and covenants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4546 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4547 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In connection with the Amendments, the Company received the proceeds of a $1,000,000 subordinated loan (the &#8220;Loan&#8221;) from GFCM. The amendment increases the aggregate amount previously loaned by GFCM to the Company from $5,500,000 to $6,500,000. All principal and interest on the Promissory Note will be due and payable at maturity on January 30, 2019. All other terms of the original Promissory Note remain in place.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4548 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4549 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On March 9, 2016, Sypris Technologies Mexico, S. de R.L. de C.V. (&#8220;Seller&#8221;), a subsidiary of the Company, concluded its sale of the Toluca property pursuant to an agreement with Promotora y Desarrolladora Pulso Inmobiliario, S.C. (together with its affiliates and assignees, &#8220;Buyer&#8221;) for 215,000,000 Mexican Pesos, or approximately, $12,100,000 in U.S. currency. Simultaneously, the Seller and the Buyer entered a long-term lease of the 9 acres currently occupied by Seller and needed for its ongoing business in Toluca (collectively, the &#8220;Toluca Sale-Leaseback&#8221;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4550 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4551 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In connection with the Term Loan Amendment noted above, the Company had agreed to deposit $6,000,000 of the proceeds of the Toluca Sale-Leaseback into a Cash Collateral Account, to be held for one year as additional collateral for the Term Loan, and this deposit was made on March 9, 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On March 9, 2016, the Term Loan lender also consented to the Toluca Sale-Leaseback
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	and released all liens on the assets associated with that sale.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4552 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA4552 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
</P>
